Technical documentation¶

Shell-like interface for game.

class cli.Dungeon(completekey='tab', stdin=None, stdout=None)¶

Game object.

complete_attack(prefix, s, idxstart, idxend)¶

Completion for attack command.

complete_move(prefix, s, idxstart, idxend)¶

Completion when typing move.

do_EOF(arg)¶

End of game by ^D escape command.

do_add(arg)¶

Add monster.

do_attack(arg)¶

Attack monster in currect cell.

do_move(arg)¶

Move player by direction.

do_show(args)¶

Show all monsters on field.

Realiztion of multi-user dungeon logic.

class core.Monster(name: str, hp: int)¶

Monster class.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of monster

  • hp (int) – Count of monster’s health points

auch()¶

Hit monster by fixed amount of hp.

is_dead() → bool¶

Check has monster more then 0 hp or not.

Returns

True if monster is dead and False if monster still alive

Return type

bool

core.add_monster(name: str, hp: int, coords: tuple[int])¶

Add new monster on field.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Monster’s name

  • hp (int) – Amount of monster’s hps

  • coords (tuple[int] size of 2) – 2D coordinates of monster on the field

core.attack_monster(name: str) → core.Monster¶

Attack monster with :name:.

Parameters

name (str) – Name of attacked monster

Raises

ValueError – Raised if current cell hasn’t monster with such name

Returns

Attacked monster

Return type

Monster

core.get_available_monsters() → List[core.Monster]¶

Return Monsters in player’s cell.

Returns

List of all monsters available to attack

Return type

List[Monster]

core.get_monsters() → Iterator[core.Monster]¶

Return generator yielding all monsters from field.

Returns

Generator yielding each monster

Return type

Iterator[Monster]

core.move_player(direction)¶

Move player on one cell by direction.

Parameters

direction (str) – Direction for move

Raises

ValueError – Error raised when trying to move outside the field
